author: thekkiidd
content:
Not sure. But originally I just followed the directions on the website I linked:
Install a recent version of Go.

$ wget https://go.dev/dl/go1.17.5.linux-amd64.tar.gz
$ sudo rm -rf /usr/local/go && sudo tar -C /usr/local -xzf go1.17.5.linux-amd64.tar.gz
$ export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin
$ echo 'PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin"' >> ~/.profile
$ rm go1.17.5.linux-amd64.tar.gz

This time it worked when I installed using:  sudo apt install golang-go

author: seamonkey82
content: <@!394119781084823552> Just a warning that if you use both methods to install go, you may end up with both `/usr/local/go/bin` and `$HOME/go/bin`, so you'll want to pay attention to which directory `go install` places things and make sure that one is included in your $PATH.

author: ohraemez
content: I got Nimbus running with geth. I also saw this error at first, when the connection to geth was not working correctly. I think the problem was that the doc said to use --web3-url=ws://127.0.0.1:8545, but geth has the WebSocket on port 8546 per default.
